If you’re due to cast your vote in the Hexham constituency on June 8 we’ve got everything you need to know right here. 
Britain will go to the polls to elect a Government and Prime Minister after Theresa May called a snap general election. 
We’ll be covering events on our live blog on election day, but in the meantime we’ve got the information you need before you decide which box to put your cross in. What constituency am I? 
Enter your postcode below to find out more details on your constituency. Which parties and candidates standing in Hexham ? Conservative - Guy Opperman Guy Opperman 
Guy won the Hexham seat in the last two general elections and is a trained barrister. 
He first got interested in national politics after giving up his time as a barrister for free to lead a campaign to fight the closure of Savernake NHS Hospital, which he credited with saving his mother’s life from cancer. 
In 2011, Guy was diagnosed with a brain tumour after suffering from headaches whilst at work in Parliament. He was rushed to hospital and underwent emergency surgery. He recovered fully after several months. Guy has written about his experience, recording his “incredible debt” to the NHS and is a leading champion of the National Health Service in Parliament. Labour - Stephen Powers Councillor Stephen Powers 
Stephen grew up in a former mining village Wheatley Hill in County Durham and attended the local comprehensive, Wellfield. 
He moved to Newcastle for university 11 years ago and remained in the city after graduating. 
He has served as a Newcastle City Councillor since 2012 and was quickly appointed to a senior position on the council. 
He comes from a strong background in community partnership building and campaigning for people with disabilities. He is passionate about folk music and preserving local heritage. In his spare time he raises funds for various mental health charities including Tyneside Mind. Lib Dem - Fiona Hall Fiona Hall 
Fiona Hall was the Liberal Democrat Member of the European Parliament from 2004 to 2014 and leader of the Lib Dem MEPs from 2009 to 2014. 
As an MEP, Fiona worked with North East companies to make sure that EU laws were supportive – for example with Nissan on electric car charging points. She played a key role in the establishment of strong 2020 goals to save energy and tackle climate change, and in the successful campaign to make lorry design safer for cyclists and pedestrians. 
In the referendum campaign last year, she campaigned tirelessly to keep Britain in the EU and is committed to fighting a hard Brexit. Green party - Wesley James Foot Wesley James Foot 
Has grown up and worked in Tynedale for 30 years. 
A self-employed heating engineer, he lives with his partner and two sons 
Wesley said he believes in a more tolerant and less divisive society, that looks to the future, for the benefit of both people and the environment. 
He is a parish councillor for Warden is hoping to bring an alternative voice to politics UKIP - Stuart Miles What was the result in Hexham in 2015? 
Guy Opperman (Con): 22,834 (52.7%) 
Liam Carr (Lab): 10,803 (24.9%) 
David Nicholson (UKIP): 4,302 (9.9%) 
Jeff Reid (Lib Dem): 2,961 (6.8%) 
Lee Williscroft-Ferris (Green): 2,445 (5.6%) 
Turnout 71.5% 
Winner: Guy Opperman (majority 12,031). Read More The North East's hardest working MPs are revealed - find out who they are Which parties and MPs have held the seat in the past? 
The only really safe seat in the whole of the North East for the Tory party. Sparsely populated and rural, the main towns are Hexham and Haltwhistle, the latter having claims to be the geographical centre of the UK. 
As well as the historic towns there are villages like Corbridge, Heddon-on-the-Wall and Stannington. To the East the constituency takes in the affluent Newcastle suburbs of Ponteland and Darras Hall. 
While Labour lost by just 200 votes in 1997 that is the closest they got ousting the Tories and since then the majority has grown massively. Read More
